intro: Dianthus companyoi, commonly known as the Sierra dianthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant produces clusters of pink or white flowers with prominent, showy petals. It typically grows in rocky or open habitats at higher elevations. Dianthus companyoi is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native range.
